headline: CFPB vs. Walmart, iPhone 16, Apollo and Workday: Top Stocks
summary: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) is suing retailer Walmart (WMT) for forcing its delivery drivers to use pricey deposit accounts in order to receive payments. Wedbush senior analyst Dan Ives published a note stating that the global demand for Apple's iPhone 16 (AAPL) has increased slightly above expectations. Apollo Global Management (APO) and Workday (WDAY) have begun trading on the S&P 500 (^GSPC) on Monday. Disclosure: Yahoo Finance is owned by Apollo Global Management. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Notified Demonstrates How GlobeNewswire Can Improve Blog Readership
summary: Data Reveals Press Release Distribution Platform Drove a 33% Increase in ViewsNEW YORK, Dec. 23, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Notified, a globally trusted technology partner for public relations and investor relations professionals, unveiled its new case study demonstrating how GlobeNewswire® can significantly increase blog readership and engagement.
